definition: to hold/to embrace/to wrap around/to gather around (sb)/to throng/to swarm/to support/Taiwan pr. [yong3]
to hold/to carry (in one's arms)/to hug/to embrace/to surround/to cherish

sentences.english: Having been dehumanized in turn, they will embrace inhumanity and brutality.
sentences.chinese: 既已被非人化，他们将拥抱非人性和残暴。

sentences.english: Joyfully, he embraced and kissed his parents and Aksah.
sentences.chinese: 他开心地拥抱，亲吻他的父母，还有阿克萨。

sentences.english: I delightedly hugged and greeted my grandchildren.
sentences.chinese: 我愉快地拥抱了我的孙子孙女，和他们打招呼。

sentences.english: Janice evaded Minmei's embrace, and nodded coolly.
sentences.chinese: 贾妮斯避开了她的拥抱礼，冷淡地点点头致意。

sentences.english: He enfolded his lover in his arms.
There, awaiting my uneasy embrace, are some five or six skateboards .
sentences.chinese: 那里，五六块轮滑板，正等候我心神不安的拥抱。

sentences.english: I enjoy cuddling with my love one and interment moments.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢拥抱我的爱一个人和安葬的时刻。

sentences.english: Then, to my sur-prise, he hugged me.
sentences.chinese: 然后，让我吃惊的是，他拥抱了我。

sentences.english: The little girl cuddled her pet cat.
sentences.chinese: 小女孩拥抱着她的宠物猫。

sentences.english: Clasp a rare and radiant maiden whom the angels name Lenore.
sentences.chinese: 拥抱被天使叫作丽诺尔的少女，她美丽娇艳。

sentences.english: A pair of iridescent pink scallops embrace each other like lovers.
sentences.chinese: 一对泛著粉彩光泽的扇贝，像情侣般相互拥抱著。

sentences.english: Hug the monster. Wrestle your fear into submission.
sentences.chinese: 拥抱怪兽，让你的恐惧向你屈服。

sentences.english: At its core, minimalism is about identifying and embracing our individual values.
sentences.chinese: 其核心是关于识别和拥抱我们每一个人的价值观。

sentences.english: Ty ran to his wife and tried to hug her.
sentences.chinese: Ty奔向他的妻子试图拥抱她。

sentences.english: Even Grandin’s own hug machine is now gathering dust.
sentences.chinese: 甚至格兰丁自己的拥抱机也铺了一层灰。

sentences.english: Thee grass seeks her crowd in the earth.
sentences.chinese: 每株青草都立在地上寻求拥抱。

definition: to hug/to cherish/within the bosom (of the family)/to embrace (also fig. an ideal, aspiration etc)
to nestle against/to snuggle up to
to give one's respects/to send a greeting/(fig.) (coll.) to make offensive reference to (somebody dear to the person to whom one is speaking)
to leave/to bid farewell to/to say good-bye to
to call out (a name etc)/to shout
care/solicitude/to show care for/concerned about/attentive to
to meet again after a long period of separation
